@tommieharve @_b___s but the world is not a safe place for rhinos, even zoos aren‚Äôt. in 2017 a rhino is a parisian zoo was shot for its horn. poaching is a human problem that can only be solved by human solutions, and naturalists in zoos are doing their best to make sure rhinos can roam free again.

@tommieharve @_b___s if all the worlds rhinos roamed free, there would be no more rhinos. in zoos, conservationists and scientists are given an environment to cure diseases, perform research, and work on breeding and improving populations of rhinos around the world.

@tommieharve @_b___s however, rhinos (and this can be extended to elephants and many other animals as well) are threatened in the wild by poaching. so much so that almost all rhino species are in some degree of danger, and some on the verge of extinction.

@tommieharve @_b___s as of 2019, there are a little over 1000 rhinos across about 300 zoos. virtually all of said rhinos are in captivity for a very simple reason: conservation. yes, thinks belong in the wild. every animal deserves to have its place in its natural habitat. üßµ

while draken horns look a lot like antelope horns, we know that they are a single, solid piece of dark horn. not bony protrusions covered in a layer of dark keratin. they're also connected to the skull, unlike the boneless rhino horns. conclusion: draken have antlers, not horns.
